Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 31st overall pick, by Oakland in 1973...
Injured on 6/13/1973 with a Bruised Wrist, out for one week...
Injured on 8/14/1973 with a Bruised Hand, out for 5 days...
Injured on 9/7/1975 with a Pulled Groin Muscle, out for 4 weeks...
Had first career hit on 4/2/1977, off Dean Chance (CAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/6/1977, off Terry Forster (CLE)...
Hit for the cycle against New York (A) on 5/24/1978...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/26/1978, hitting .440 with 3 HR, 11 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 6/1/1978, hitting .358 with 8 HR, 30 RBI...
Was selected to the 1978 Allstar game...
Injured on 7/27/1979 with a Fractured Hip, out for 8 weeks...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Minnesota on 4/22/1980...
Was selected to the 1980 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1981, hitting .364 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by New York (N) on 2/7/1983 to a 4-year deal worth $6,500,000 per year...
Had 20-game hitting streak snapped on 5/6/1983...
Was selected to the 1983 Allstar game...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1983...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Pittsburgh on 8/2/1984...
Drove in 6 runs against Pittsburgh on 7/10/1985...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1985, hitting .414 with 1 HR, 9 RBI...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1985...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against St. Louis on 4/28/1987...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1987...
Had 23-game hitting streak snapped on 9/29/1988...
Traded from New York (N) to Texas on 2/1/1989 (Going to NYM: LF E. Sprague Jr., P C. Nagy, P G. Hoffman. Going to TEX: P T. Boggs, 1B G. Biagini, DH A. Dawson, P G. Nelson)...
